intro: Chaeturus spicatus, commonly known as the spiny grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, spiky appearance. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in spikelets, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
